EasyOverrider

Interface RecursionPreventingToString


  • public interface RecursionPreventingToString
    Interface to implement when you have a possibly recursive toString() method.
    This interface defines two methods:
    • toString(Map) - must be implemented
    • primaryToString() - only needs to be implemented if your ParamList contains primary parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default String primaryToString()
      A toString method that uses only the primary parameters.
      The default implementation just returns null.
      Implementation often looks something like this:
      String toString(Map<Class,Set<Integer>> seen)
      A toString method that, as it generates the strings of parameters, records the hashCodes of objects as it goes in order to prevent a recursive toString call.
      Implementation often looks something like this:

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        String toString(Map<Class,Set<Integer>> seen)
        A toString method that, as it generates the strings of parameters, records the hashCodes of objects as it goes in order to prevent a recursive toString call.
        Implementation often looks something like this:
         

 public String toString(final Map<Class, Set<Integer>> seen) {
     return paramList.toString(this, seen);
 }
        Parameters:
        seen - the map of class to sets of hashCodes of objects that have already been toString-ified.
        Returns:
        A String representation of this object.

      • primaryToString

        default String primaryToString()
        A toString method that uses only the primary parameters.
        The default implementation just returns null.
        Implementation often looks something like this:
         

 public String primaryToString() {
     return paramList.primaryToString(this);
 }
        Returns:
        A String of the object containing only primary parameter information.
